item.text: Became Public Law No: 111-314.

Signed by President.
Signed by President.
Presented to President.
Presented to President.
Cleared for White House.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S8479)
Passed/agreed to in Senate: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR S8479)
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 371.
Committee on the Judiciary. Reported by Senator Leahy without amendment. Without written report.
Committee on the Judiciary. Reported by Senator Leahy without amendment. Without written report.
Committee on the Judiciary. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote. (text: CR H67-104)
Passed/agreed to in House: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.(text: CR H67-104)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3237.
Considered under suspension of the rules. (consideration: CR H67-104)
Mr. Cohen moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 127.
Reported by the Committee on Judiciary. H. Rept. 111-325.
Reported by the Committee on Judiciary. H. Rept. 111-325.
Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E1818)
Introduced in House
Introduced in House

item.title: H.R. 3237, An act to enact certain laws relating to national and commercial space programs as title 51, United States Code, "National and Commercial Space Programs"
item.description: Cost estimate for the bill as ordered reported by the Senate Committee on the Judiciary on May 10, 2010

item.text: A page further explaining the bill is available from the Office of the Law Revision Counsel at http://uscode.house.gov/codification/t51/index.html.

summary.text: Enacts title 51 of the United States Code into positive law to be entitled "National and Commercial Space Programs." Makes conforming changes to existing law and repeals specified provisions of specified laws.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
